website_summaries.verdict: The HP Pavilion Mini is a competent small-form-factor desktop PC with basic features and 1TB of local storage. It's a good choice if you want more than just a media streamer in your den.
pros: Comes with wireless keyboard and mouse

customer_reviews.title: HP mini
customer_reviews.text: Great little box. I have an Apple mini and this one blows it away... but only after some easy upgrades. First to go was the storage. I upgraded to a 2tb HDD, and installed an internal SSD in the bare socket. This allowed me to have the 128gb SSD as my root/boot drive, Tat really made bootup super fast. Next I upgraded the OEM 4gb of memory to 16gb. Lastly a 4 port USB hub These upgrades were a piece of cake to do. Much easier then Apple and way more economical.
customer_reviews.author: D. BODKIN

customer_reviews.title: What a space saver
customer_reviews.text: My daughter recommended I get this compact desktop for my PC and lose the huge "tower." I was so happy I listened to her! It freed up a whole shelf in my desk. I was hesitate for a second because it doesn't have a disc drive, but you can easily buy one for those rare times that you can't download what you're what you need. Great product. Never any issue and I've had it for years.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Aranda

customer_reviews.title: It'll will be perfect if it can be mounted
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my favorite Lenovo Q190 is no longer available. What I like about Q190 is is sleeker and comes with a mounting bracket. This Pavilion Mini can only by placed in one position on the table and cannot be mounted. The design is cute and decorative. As for performance, it does the job very well for media viewing and light office tasks. Runs Windows 10 and Office 360 without problem. One star is removed because there's no way you can mount it. If you don't need to mount this somewhere, this is a great and reliable mini PC to have. I have two of these and two of Q190.
customer_reviews.author: Mat633

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little machine
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little machine. It's no Nuc5i7, but it comes with wireless keyboard, mouse, and Windows, for a very low entry price. I added one 8G SODIMM and replaced the HDD with a spare notebook 240G SSD that I had laying around and it gets the job done in a very small footprint at the lowest price point. Stream internal storage is just too small, and with no SATA cable, just not an option. This is definitely cheaper once you realize that you have to purchase an M.2 card to make the Stream viable. The Pavilion Mini is the best very small system for the money right now.
customer_reviews.author: William T. Musil

customer_reviews.title: Great tiny desktop option for a spacesaver in my kids room!!
customer_reviews.text: Great computer & monitor but we ended up buying new keyboard & mouse so it was wireless. (The ones included are usb keyboard and mouse) but it has been great for taking up hardly any space in my son's room so he can do homework, although he has spent more time playing minecraft than homework since he got it! We are very happy with the performance of this tiny desktop!! We ended up hooking it up to his tv that is mounted on the wall, I only wish this computer had a bracket to mount it behind the tv, then it would be perfect with a wireless mouse/keyboard it is completely out of the was until you need it!!
customer_reviews.author: T. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Very good value so far
customer_reviews.text: Very simple to set up. Comes with keyboard and mouse, even including batteries. Had to force open the keyboard with some violence to activate the batteries. Seems just about fast enough. Very good value so far.
customer_reviews.author: Radley

customer_reviews.title: Like clockwork. Otherwise works well and was a decent ...
customer_reviews.text: Looks and works well. The only persistent problem is the WiFi card/adapter. It loses the connection frequently (every couple days consistently), where you have to forget the network and re-connect to it. Like clockwork. Otherwise works well and was a decent value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Slonka

customer_reviews.title: Great workhorses for simple applications and web use (YouTube
customer_reviews.text: Using these in our classrooms. Great workhorses for simple applications and web use (YouTube, etc.).
customer_reviews.author: Are you kidding?

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Really, this is an amazing little computer. It is powerful and silent and really does the job for us. It came with an automatic upgrade to Windows 10, which I used. I scrubbed the bloatware and it is now a fixture on my wife's desk.
customer_reviews.author: BilltheNuke

customer_reviews.title: I like this little bugger a lot
customer_reviews.text: I like this little bugger a lot. It's not as fast as I had anticipated but for the price and size it's just right. If anything get the faster hard drive and processor though.
customer_reviews.author: William Schmitt

customer_reviews.title: Great choice as supplement to Tablet
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, easy to use. Solid performance for occasional internet usage, photo management as supplement to a tablet (iPad).

I have not had one problem at all... and it took me all of about 15 mins to get it up and running and that was getting a new Monitor put up to. customer_reviews.text: These work very well. Fast and easy. Make perfect VDI desktop devices.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Gilsenan

customer_reviews.title: The size is amazing and has allowed me to organize my work space ...
customer_reviews.text: The size is amazing and has allowed me to organize my work space much better. It is so much faster than my old computer. Getting used to not having discs is taking some rethinking.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine C Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Nice if you have basic needs.
customer_reviews.text: Basic power. Small box - that is nice. Comes with everything but the screen - that is nice. Keyboard and mouse are comfortable. Not a lot of graphic or processor power here - but perfect for web surfing, casual gaming (Bejeweled), word processing and speadsheets. Makes a great little started computer of something for the grand parents. Comes with lots of HP software.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Moore

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this. Has plenty of memory. Great for everyday use. No problems so far. I prefer HP.
customer_reviews.author: Web Marvels

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Affordable. Perfect size. It doesn't take up much room on your desk. Very streamlined. Cons : Glitchy. Freezes and lags. Mouse can be frustrating to use. We replaced the keyboard with a wireless Logitec keyboard, no problems. We upgraded the memory with hopes that it would help some of the problems but it didn't change much. This is a great concept, but you do get what you're paying for, so long as you limit your use to the basics and don't have expectations for it to be a workhorse computer then you will be satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: unsatisfied with product

customer_reviews.title: Excellent PC!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent computer! It's fast, powerful, and you can even increase the RAM. It came with 4 GB of RAM, but I added 4 GB more, and it's a dream. It streams well, starts up fast, and does exactly what I need. I love the fact that it's small. My previous computer was big and bulky, but this one fits nicely on my desk behind the monitor. I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Coronado

customer_reviews.title: Replace mouse and keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Dear god the mouse and keyboard are horrendous. I thought the computer itself was laggy and was about to return the device, but before doing so I plugged in another mouse and now this computer is just great!
